meanings.definition: A list of sources used in research or writing.
meanings.sent1: In my bibliography, I included all the books and websites I used for my project.
meanings.sent2: The bibliography at the end of the book listed all the references the author consulted.
meanings.sent3: I found it funny that my bibliography was longer than my actual essay!
meanings.sent4: Her bibliography was like a treasure map leading to all the knowledge she gathered.
meanings.sent5: Creating a bibliography can help you keep track of where you found your information.

meanings.definition: A list of books or articles about a particular subject.
meanings.sent1: The bibliography on ancient history included many rare books.
meanings.sent2: When writing a thesis, it's important to have a comprehensive bibliography.
meanings.sent3: I joked that my bibliography was so long, it could be its own library!
meanings.sent4: Her bibliography resembled a garden of knowledge waiting to be explored.
meanings.sent5: Exploring the bibliography of a topic can lead you to unexpected discoveries.

meanings.definition: The study of books and writings.
meanings.sent1: In her bibliography class, she learned about different citation styles.
meanings.sent2: His passion for bibliography led him to become a librarian.
meanings.sent3: Studying bibliography made her appreciate the effort behind each book.
meanings.sent4: The professor's knowledge of bibliography was as vast as a library itself.
meanings.sent5: Immersing yourself in bibliography can open doors to new literary worlds.
